inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getConnection.

name.description:
CodeStar Connection name.

> **NOTE:** When both `arn` and `name` are specified, `arn` takes precedence.

tags.description: Map of key-value resource tags to associate with the resource.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getConnection.

connectionStatus.description: CodeStar Connection status. Possible values are `PENDING`, `AVAILABLE` and `ERROR`.

hostArn.description: ARN of the host associated with the connection.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

name.description: Name of the CodeStar Connection. The name is unique in the calling AWS account.

providerType.description: Name of the external provider where your third-party code repository is configured. Possible values are `Bitbucket` and `GitHub`. For connections to a GitHub Enterprise Server instance, you must create an aws.codestarconnections.Host resource and use `host_arn` instead.

tags.description: Map of key-value resource tags to associate with the resource.
